title: PFL 2019, Playoffs 2 predictions: Will two defending champs advance to finals?
text:
The 2019 PFL playoffs continue Thursday, with the featherweight and lightweight brackets set to fight until a final is determined.

The eight-man featherweight bracket is led by No. 1 seed and defending champion Lance Palmer taking on No. 8 Gadzhi Rabadanov. The winner of that fight meets the winner of Alex Gilpin vs. Andre Harrison in one semifinal. On the other side of the bracket, the winnerss of No. 2 Movlid Khaybulaev vs. No. 7 Daniel Pineda and No. 3 Luis Rafael Laurentino vs. No. 6 Jeremy Kennedy will meet in the other semifinal.

Over at lightweight, another defending champion begins his quest to repeat as No. 1 Natan Schulte takes on Ramsey Nijem, with the winner meeting No. 4 Akhmed Aliev or No. 5 Rashid Magomedov in the semis. Meanwhile, No. 2 Islam Mamedov fights No. 7 Loik Radzhabov, with the winner facing No. 3 Chris Wade or No. 6 Nate Andrews.

Here’s a look at each bracket.

Featherweight

Lightweight

PFL 2019, Playoffs 2 takes place at Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, and the card streams on ESPN+ and airs on ESPN2. You can check out the MMA Junkie staff’s predictions below:
